meanings.definition: A person who behaves in a deceitful or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The momsers in the story tricked the main character with their lies.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was a momsers when he promised things he never delivered.
meanings.sent3: The momsers tried to sell a broken toy as brand new.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as fake as a momsers' promise.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the momsers who pretend to be your friends.

meanings.sent1: They momsers their way into getting free food at the event.

meanings.sent3: She momsers her brother into giving her his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The con artist momsers innocent people out of their savings.
meanings.sent5: The magician momsers the audience with his tricks.

meanings.sent1: His momsers of stealing money from the company was discovered.
meanings.sent2: The momsers of hiding the truth led to their downfall.
meanings.sent3: The momsers of pretending to be sick to skip school didn't fool anyone.
